repnme.cdata!:
Kosovo, Federal Republic of Yugoslavia -
            Third Economic Assistance Grant to Support Private Sector
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            and the overall sustainability rating of the reforms
            supported by the Grant appears likely. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are considered satisfactory. Lessons
            learned include the following: This project demonstrates the
            Bank's catalytic role by providing scarce budget
            support resources that are specifically linked to sectoral
            policies. Much of the effectiveness of the policies
            supported by the project reflect a project design that
            tackled key priorities that had been clearly identified by
            the interim administration of Kosovo and the Bank's
            trasitional support strategy. Clear focus on limited
            outcomes was crucial to achieve tangible results. Kosovo is
            a good example of a post-conflict situation where particular
            emphasis was put on selctivity of the activities the Bank
            could support with limited resources. Ownership by the
            interim administration was an absolutely necessary condition
            to achieve proper selectivity and adequate prioritization of
            conditionalities. Local consultation in which the Bank
            played a key role were crucial given the early stages of the
            interim administration's mandate in Kosovo. Frequent,
            close, and intensive consultation with donor was critical.
